unnormalised: Chennai, India – Accurate inventory forecasting is poised to become a game-changer for Indian manufacturers, reducing waste and boosting efficiency, industry experts say. Dr. Sharma, head of the Operations Management department at IIM Bangalore, emphasizes that "effective forecasting, especially with robust data analytics, can slash inventory holding costs by up to 20%."

unnormalised: For instance, a textile manufacturer in Surat, Gujarat, reported a 15% reduction in storage space requirements (freeing up valuable 5000 sq ft) after implementing a new forecasting model. The system predicts yarn demand with improved accuracy, minimizing overstocking and stockouts. This shift also frees up working capital, saving Rs. 5 Lakhs per month in carrying costs. The improved practices are expected to enhance the competitiveness of Indian manufacturing on the global stage.
